item.description:
Click and Shoot Event: 180th Annual Massachusetts Camellia Society Show

The cost of admission: $10.00/adult

Date: Sunday, February 22
Time: Noon
Location: Tower Hill Botanic Gardens
11 French Drive
Boylston . Massachusetts 01505.0598
Phone: 508.869.6111 x110 for information

We will meet inside the entrance of the The Stoddard Education and Visitors Center

The Camellia show runs Saturday, February 21 & Sunday, February 22 from 10am -5pm
The cost of admission: $10.00/adult

This Click and Shoot is being run by Michael Merline... here is what he has to say about the event:
I went to this event last year and it was absolutely spectacular! You won’t believe the colors and the scents of the Camellia flowers and other flowers and plants in the garden! Your cameras (and you) will be smiling with joy when you capture the colors!

Tower Hill Botanical Garden is a beautiful & peaceful place to spend a Sunday afternoon. Leave the ice, snow and cold weather behind to relax and enjoy the warmth and colors of the indoor garden.

The Massachusetts Camellia Society, one of the oldest societies in the United States, will present the 180th Annual Camellia Show at Tower Hill Botanic Garden. See hundreds of gorgeous Camellia flowers at the peak of their display—both on the Camellia trees themselves as part of Tower Hill’s own collection, and also in bowls of floating blossoms from private collections.

We can get a bite to eat at the Twigs restaurant that is in the building after the event.
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet inside the entrance of the The Stoddard Education & Visitors Center

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP
